perturbation.original_text:
2.10 Control. “Control” (including the terms “Controlling” and “Controlled by”) of a Person shall mean
(i) holding fifty percent (50%) or more ownership or beneficial interest of income and capital of such
Person; or (ii) having ownership of at least fifty percent (50%)
perturbation.changed_text:
2.10 Control. “Control” (including the terms “Controlling” and “Controlled by”) of a Person shall mean
(i) holding twenty percent (20%) or more ownership or beneficial interest of income and capital of such
Person; or (ii) having ownership of at least twenty percent (20%)
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines "Control" as requiring 50% or more ownership or beneficial interest.  The modified text reduces this threshold to 20%. This creates a direct contradiction because a party could be considered in 'Control' under the modified definition while not meeting the original definition, leading to uncertainty regarding Change of Control implications and obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
3.22 Offset Right. Any amounts payable (including any recoupment claims or other amounts to be
reimbursed) by Vendor or its Affiliates to AT&T or its Affiliates under this Agreement (including under the
Build Addendum or the Maintenance Addendum) may be offset against the Maintenance Fees or any
payment due or to become due to Vendor or its Affiliates from AT&T or its Affiliates under the Transport
Agreement, Master License Agreement; provided, however, that AT&T’s offset right under this Section
3.22 shall not apply to any Structured Payments for any Cell Site that has reached Location Acceptance
and AT&T hereby waives all such rights of setoff and recoupment against such Structured Payments. Prior
to exercising its right to offset amounts pursuant to this Section 3.22, AT&T shall provide written notice to
Vendor of its intention to offset such amounts and to the extent any dispute between the Parties exists in
respect of the amount to be offset, AT&T must first utilize the Escalation Procedure in Section 4.8(a).
perturbation.changed_text:
3.22 Offset Right. Any amounts payable (including any recoupment claims or other amounts to be
reimbursed) by Vendor or its Affiliates to AT&T or its Affiliates under this Agreement (including under the
Build Addendum or the Maintenance Addendum) may be offset against the Maintenance Fees or any
payment due or to become due to Vendor or its Affiliates from AT&T or its Affiliates under the Transport
Agreement, Master License Agreement; AT&T’s offset right under this Section
3.22 applies to any Structured Payments for any Cell Site that has reached Location Acceptance
and AT&T hereby reserves all such rights of setoff and recoupment against such Structured Payments. Prior
to exercising its right to offset amounts pursuant to this Section 3.22, AT&T is not required to provide written notice to
Vendor of its intention to offset such amounts and to the extent any dispute between the Parties exists in
respect of the amount to be offset, AT&T is not required to utilize the Escalation Procedure in Section 4.8(a).
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly waives AT&T's right to offset against Structured Payments after Location Acceptance and requires written notice and escalation. The modified version states the opposite: AT&T *reserves* those rights, and doesn't need to provide notification or escalation. This creates a direct contradiction about whether AT&T can offset against completed projects, creating significant financial uncertainty for the Vendor.

perturbation.original_text:
Vendor will maintain a streamlined
escalation process to speed resolution of reported problems.
4.24 Testimony. Matters relating to Work under this Agreement may be at issue before various governmental
bodies. Vendor agrees to have appropriate members of its company willing to testify at appropriate times
at no additional cost, regarding any aspect of the Work, unless otherwise mutually agreed upon by the
Parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
Vendor will not maintain a streamlined
escalation process to speed resolution of reported problems.
4.24 Testimony. Matters relating to Work under this Agreement may be at issue before various governmental
bodies. Vendor can't agree to have appropriate members of its company willing to testify at appropriate times
at no additional cost, regarding any aspect of the Work, unless otherwise mutually agreed upon by the
Parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires the Vendor to maintain a streamlined escalation process. The modified version now says that the vendor won't maintain a streamlined escalation process which opposes the original terms of service. Original terms are clear that vendor needs to send its personnel to testity at no cost unless it is mutually agreed but now the vendor can't agree to send it's personnel at no cost as well.
